metadata.description: A KEDA HTTPScaledObject is a Kubernetes custom resource definition (CRD) used in conjunction with the KEDA HTTP Add-on to enable the automatic scaling of your HTTP-based applications based on incoming HTTP traffic. This means your application can dynamically adjust the number of replicas (pods) running to handle varying workloads efficiently.

patch.description: Create an HTTPScaledObject resource to define the scaling behavior for your Deployment or StatefulSet. It specifies the target application (Deployment name) and the minimum/maximum replica count.
Autoscale any Kubernetes Deployments and StatefulSets that expose HTTP-based applications (and handles incoming HTTP traffic).
